definition: to give audience (of emperor)/retainers' duty to pay respect to sovereign/hajj (Islam)
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning
(history) to have an audience with the Emperor

sentences.english: We saw his star as it rose, and we have come to worship him.
sentences.chinese: 我們看見屬於他的那顆星升起了，我們來朝覲。

sentences.english: Rather a pilgrim is to supplicate Allah and ask Him whatever he desires.
sentences.chinese: 更正確的是朝覲者祈禱安拉，向安拉尋求自己的願望。

sentences.english: They will wait after the end of this year's pilgrimage to re-opening Umrah Visa application.
sentences.chinese: 之後將等待今年朝覲結束後，再行開放受理副朝簽證。

sentences.english: Giving Adhan upon departure of the pilgrims.
sentences.chinese: 爲出發的朝覲者念宣禮詞。

sentences.english: North Koreans make pilgrimages to the mountain, and students march up its summit singing songs.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮人來到這座山上朝覲，學生們爬上山頂歌唱。

sentences.english: All of them had pilgrimaged to the capital.
sentences.chinese: 他們所有人都到首都朝覲去了。

sentences.english: They had pilgrimed for that peace.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲了那次和平而去朝覲。

sentences.english: Umra refers to other pilgrimages to Mecca, which can take place any time of the year.
sentences.chinese: Umra指一年中的任何時間進行的麥加朝覲。

sentences.english: Making Dhikr and Takbir loudly upon the leaving or arrival of the pilgrims.
sentences.chinese: 離開或到達的朝覲者大聲地念紀念詞和大讚辭。

sentences.english: Jeddah is the main entry to the kingdom for pilgrims.
sentences.chinese: 吉達是朝覲者進入沙特的緊張入口。

sentences.english: No pilgrims attending the annual hajj were among the dead, officials said.
sentences.chinese: 官員說，死者中異國發覺麥加朝覲者。

sentences.english: Muslim pilgrims arrive at the plain of Arafat, near Mecca December 18, 2007 .
sentences.chinese: 穆斯林朝覲者抵達靠近麥加的阿拉法特平原。

definition: Binyang county in Nanning 南寧|南宁[Nan2 ning2], Guangxi
famous/of good reputation
to pay homage at a mausoleum
"the four classes" of ancient China, i.e. scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants
ceremony
ancestral hall/temple to one's forebears
prime minister (in ancient China)
to spread/to hand down/to disseminate
Lelang commandery (108 BC-313 AD), one of four Han dynasty commanderies in north Korea
to ascend the throne
to go on a hunting expedition
to be in overall charge/to oversee
extinct
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
Juyongguan, frontier fortress on Great Wall north of Beijing, in Changping district 昌平區|昌平区[Chang1 ping2 qu1]
to open up land (for agriculture)
